content.question: The magnitude of the momentum of an object as a function of time, in seconds, is given by <math alttext="p equals, open parenthesis, 4 kilogram meters per second cubed, close parenthesis, times t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>â‹…</mo><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>. The magnitudes of the net force exerted on the object at times <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="t sub 2 equals 2 t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> are <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, respectively. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub 2 equals 2 F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub 2 equals 4 F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub 2 equals 8 F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub 2 equals 16 F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub 2 equals 2 F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
